intro: Scorzonera kotschyi, commonly known as the Armenian scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and latex-producing tissues. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, exhibiting a compact growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Scorzonera kotschyi is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
